DataElement.preferredName: Image Study Admitting Diagnosis Code Sequence DICOM Sequence of Items Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded sequence that conveys the admitting diagnosis (diagnoses) for a radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location.  Size of text may be an Explicit Length or variable Undefined Length.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Image Study Admitting Diagnosis Code Sequence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A coded sequence that conveys the admitting diagnosis (diagnoses) for a radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose.

Concepts.definition: A radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose.

Property.preferredDefinition: The condition of being allowed to enter.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

Concepts.definition: The condition of being allowed to enter; the activity of admitting someone to something.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
A serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/11/09 Draft New DEC versioned for change in OC concept to Image Study as requested by VCDE Silver Review Team.  6/6/07 DEC created to support DICOM CDE task utilizing IE DICOM Attribute terms.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: SQ: Text used to describe named areas of the body as an order set of zero to 'n' values referenced by ordinal position starting with 1 as defined in the 2007 DICOM, Part 5, Paragraph 7.5 Nesting of Data Sets. Size of text may be an Explicit Length or variable Undefined Length.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.:A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.
A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 11/20/13 datatype changed to charater to support OCI. jc  2/11/09 released because VD used in NCIA DE to be released.  8/21/07-DICOM SQ value representation type for DICOM which has a variable size

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 5/20/14 CDE versioned to use newer version of VD as part of Rel CDE w retired VD content review. jc2/11/09 CDE versioned due to DEC/OC change to Image Study concept (C63859) per Silver Rev changes.  11/2/07 Added missing DICOM alt name.  10/10/07  updated for revised CS value representation value domain.  8/22/07-Added RIDER reference from retired CDE 2414568.    8/21/07-CDE created to support DICOM CDE IE - DICOM Attribute-DICOM VR Rep term format.
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 9/10/23 upd sys generated definition to human readable to support reuse in CDS imaging template. jk
